senses.ex: Sea level is the average height of the ocean's surface.

Tips.title: Geographical Reference
Tips.description: Used to describe natural or established heights against which other elevations are measured.
Tips.example: Mount Everest is 8,848 meters above sea level.

Tips.title: Comparative Measure
Tips.description: Can compare stages of progress, development, or quality.
Tips.example: Her cooking skill is at a professional level.

senses.de: The amount something is at, especially in amount or size
senses.ex: He has a high level of intelligence.

Tips.title: Indicates Extent
Tips.description: Expresses intensity, extent, or concentration of a trait or phenomenon.
Tips.example: The river's water level rose due to the rain.

Tips.title: Subjective Assessment
Tips.description: Can describe perceived qualities, not just measurable amounts.
Tips.example: She showed a high level of enthusiasm.

senses.de: At the same height as someone or something else
senses.ex: Their eyes were level with each other.

Tips.title: Physical Alignment
Tips.description: Refers to the positioning of objects or people on the same horizontal plane.
Tips.example: The table needs to be level with the window sill.

senses.de: To make a surface smooth and flat
senses.ex: He levelled the ground before building the house.

Tips.title: Construction Work
Tips.description: Often used in building, landscaping, and DIY terminology.
Tips.example: We need to level the floor before laying tiles.

senses.de: To aim or direct something at someone or something
senses.ex: The soldier levelled his gun at the target.

Tips.title: Preparation of Threat
Tips.description: Can imply the act of threatening by aiming a weapon.
Tips.example: He levelled a warning glance before speaking.

senses.de: A device used for determining or adjusting something to a vertical or horizontal position
senses.ex: The builder used a level to make sure the wall was straight.

Tips.title: Precision Instrument
Tips.description: Refers to a tool that ensures accuracy in establishing a plane.
Tips.example: Use the spirit level for hanging pictures straight.

Tips.title: Assessment Context
Tips.description: Technical domain often deals with accuracy and precision.
Tips.example: Check the fluid level with the dipstick.

senses.de: The standard of power or ability in a game or system
senses.ex: He has a low level character in the game.

Tips.title: Gaming Progression
Tips.description: In gaming, level can refer to the player's experience or game stages.
Tips.example: I reached level 30 in my favorite game.

senses.de: To drop to zero or eliminate completely
senses.ex: The politician promised to level taxes.

Tips.title: Idiomatic Use
Tips.description: Can mean to remove disparities or make things equal.
Tips.example: The new policy aims to level the playing field for small businesses.

Tips.title: Destructive Connotation
Tips.description: Has an aggressive or devastating implication in certain contexts.

Equal.wordDefinition:
While both equal and level refer to something being balanced or the same in some way, they are used in different situations.

Equal is used when referring to things that are the same in value or quantity. For example, "The two students received equal scores on their exams.".

Equal is used when things are the same in value or quantity, while level is used when things are the same in height or position.

Even.wordDefinition:
Even refers to something that is flat or has a smooth surface, while the word level means that something is at the same height or position.

For example, a table can be even if all four legs are the same length and keep it level on the ground. A shelf can be level if it is parallel to the ground and not tilted in any direction.

Even refers more to a surface, while level pertains more to the position of an object in relation to something else.

Flat.wordDefinition:
Flat means something that has a smooth and even surface, which is usually horizontal or parallel to the ground. For example, a flat table or a flat piece of paper.

Therefore, while flat describes the physical appearance of something, level describes its position or orientation relative to a standard.

Both words can be applicable in different situations, such as describing the surface of a road (flat) or making sure a shelf is mounted straight (level).

Horizontal.wordDefinition:
Horizontal refers to something that is parallel to the ground or floor. This means that it is flat and parallel to the surface beneath it.

However, horizontal specifically refers to something being flat and parallel to the ground, while level refers to something being balanced and at the same height as another object.

Parallel.wordDefinition:
Parallel refers to two or more things that are running alongside each other, but never meet. For example, train tracks are parallel to each other.

Level refers to height or slope, while parallel describes the position and direction of two or more things.

Plane.wordDefinition:
Plane refers to a flat surface that extends infinitely in all directions, like a sheet of paper.

The main difference between level and plane is that level refers to a specific surface that is flat and even, while plane refers to any flat surface, whether it is part of a larger object or extends infinitely in all directions.

Smooth.wordDefinition:
Smooth refers to a surface that lacks roughness or is free from uneven texture or roughness. It is applicable to surfaces that are soft to the touch, such as skin or fabrics.

Level is concerned with flatness and stability, while smooth is concerned with texture and feel.

Uniform.wordDefinition:
Uniform refers to clothing that is the same design or style worn by members of a group or organization. It also describes a consistent or unchanging pattern or behavior.

For example, a uniformed officer of law enforcement may wear the same clothing as others in their department, and a school may have a uniform policy for its students.

Level refers to the position of an object, while uniform refers to the consistent style of a garment or a behavioral pattern.

quotes.Text: I got my first computer in the 6th grade or so. As soon as I got it, I was interested in finding out how it worked and how the programs worked and then figuring out how to write programs at just deeper and deeper levels within the system.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Mark Zuckerberg

quotes.Text: Once you get on the playing field it's not about whether you're liked or not liked. All that matters is to play at a high level and do whatever it takes to help your team win. That's what it's about.
quotes.Title: American Basketball Player
quotes.Name: LeBron James

quotes.Text: I like movies where you feel like you're going into another world, and no matter how many times you watch it, you're gonna see something new in that world. That level of detail really inspires me.
quotes.Title: Actor
quotes.Name: Nicolas Cage

quotes.Text: The level of our success is limited only by our imagination and no act of kindness, however small, is ever wasted.
quotes.Title: Greek Author
quotes.Name: Aesop

quotes.Text: Don't lower your expectations to meet your performance. Raise your level of performance to meet your expectations.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Ralph Marston

quotes.Text: Of course it is very important for me to play for Croatia, however different it is to play at club level.
quotes.Title: Croatian Athlete
quotes.Name: Luka Modric

quotes.Text: Neymar is a player at a whole different level, in a different world.
quotes.Title: Costa Rican Athlete
quotes.Name: Keylor Navas

quotes.Text: I came to magic absolutely hating magic on a very, very deep level.
quotes.Title: American Entertainer
quotes.Name: Penn Jillette

quotes.Text: A person places themselves on a level with the ones they praise.
quotes.Title: German Writer
quotes.Name: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.Text: I want there to be a level of respect between everybody.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Kenny Chesney
